definition: old name for Shanghai 上海[Shang4 hai3]/surname Shen
to extend/to state/to explain/9th earthly branch: 3-5 p.m., 7th solar month (7th August-7th September), year of the Monkey/ancient Chinese compass point: 240°
to blame/to reprove/to reprimand/to expel/to oust/to reconnoiter/(of territory) to expand/saline marsh

sentences.english: He was sharply reprimanded for his negligence.
sentences.chinese: 他因玩忽職責而受到嚴厲的申斥。

sentences.english: His parents will reprimand him when he shows them his report card.
sentences.chinese: 當他把分數單交給父母親看時，他們將嚴厲申斥他。

sentences.english: We murmur alike reproachfully rolling sands and drift, knowing not why.
sentences.chinese: 我們貌似低語卻在申斥滾石漂移，不知道累。

sentences.english: He was castigated for his carelessness in doing homework.
sentences.chinese: 他由於做作業時馬馬虎虎而受到申斥。

sentences.english: I think such public reprimands should be heard on the streets of Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲，這種公開的申斥應該在北京街頭聽到。

sentences.english: After the severest reprimand , he did not tremble .
sentences.chinese: 即使受到最嚴厲的申斥，他也不發抖。

sentences.english: Tom was sat on for showing off.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆因耍小聰明受到了申斥。

sentences.english: The student was shaken up by his mother.
sentences.chinese: 那個學生被他母親申斥了一頓。

sentences.english: Bill was often called down by his teacher for doing homework carelessly.
sentences.chinese: 比爾常常由於做作業粗枝大葉而受到老師的申斥。

sentences.english: The principal called in the students and laid down the law to them about skipping classes.
sentences.chinese: 校長召集學生申斥他們有關跳班的問題。

sentences.english: The teacher came down on her for talking in class.
sentences.chinese: 老師因爲她在上課時說話而嚴厲申斥她。
這番申斥獲得了高聲的喝彩。

sentences.english: The forest family member reprimands the police again and again, the request "pays with a life by the life".
sentences.chinese: 林的家人一遍又一遍地申斥警方，要求“以命償命”。

sentences.english: Even reproofs from authority, ought to be grave, and not taunting.
sentences.chinese: 即使上官申斥，亦宜出之以嚴肅，而不應惡語傷人。

definition: to warn/to blame/to rebuke/also written 申斥
to accuse/to impeach/(in imperial China) to level charges against an official
to sack/to remove from a position/to depose
to denounce/to condemn/to call to account/to punish
